issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
I have a simple webview, opening 'http://google.com':
{code}Titanium.UI.createWebView({url: 'http://google.com', scalesPageToFit:true});{code}
 I'm trying to type something in textfield. Keyboard appears on focus and cursor is within the textfield, however if I type something, the textfield remains empty.
If I open google.com in device browser, it works fine. Also on other Android devices (HTC One, Samsung) it works well.
This looks like the existing issue in here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2083909/why-is-android-webview-refusing-user-input
fields.summary: Android HTC Desire 500: cannot type in textfields on webview
fields.environment:
Device: HTC Desire 500
Android version: 4.1.2
HTC SDK API Level: 5.26
Kernel version: 3.4.0-g194e107 root@abm019 #1 SMP PREEMPT

comments.body: We can not replicate the issue, please share more info and details and if it's still an issue using 3.4.0.GA reopen the ticket.
